urls.title: Farmers need key role in water management – NFU - Farmers Weekly
urls.description: Widespread winter flooding has once again highlighted the urgent need for a national strategy which gives farmers a key role in water management, say

tweets.text:
With vast areas of farmland once again under water, @NFUtweets wants farmers to have a key role in land and water management.

"It is vital we act now to safeguard the nation's food security, environment and livelihoods," says @HertsFarmer.

https://t.co/2iSfz6feGv

#farminguk

Ark is a multi-million-pound National Flood Resilience Centre planned for the Humber region.

It aims to provide emergency services and responders with a controlled environment for simulated training in flood events, and includes a full-scale 120m street scene and rapids course. https://t.co/oGTwDvDdp4

tweets.text:
Our field team is out clearing debris screens across the #NorthEast following last week's #stormchristoph 

Here at Spring Gardens dam at Bishop Auckland, a large amount of woody debris and branches were removed, ensuring the River Gaunless can flow freely. 

#Flood 
#River https://t.co/9gIQRc0DK6

Pumping operations continue in #Malton and #Norton as groundwater levels in the area remain high even though river levels are falling. We have a multi-agency pumping plan in place and continue to monitor this to manage levels and reduce #flood risk. https://t.co/6T6t4GZCd0 https://t.co/8ObLQDSWHT

tweets.text:
@agricontract @StHelensEnviro @hortijames @EnvAgency @HerefordshireWT Correct marshes around beccles flooded for 2 weeks 
Advice we’re given “ don’t clean the ditches to save the water voles” not cleaning has destroyed all voles and habitat

Have you spotted microplastics on the beach this weekend? 

If so please let us know the location and share any pictures as we are working with others to investigate. 

@wyrecouncil @EnvAgency @unitedutilities @LivingSeasNW @_MBay 

📸: Christine Taylor https://t.co/YunT1Gzg04
@NicolaCutcher @EnvAgency @GeorgeMonbiot Do update everyone if you manage to get a response.

Astonished to learn that on 14 Jan @EnvAgency Chief Exec @JamesBevanEA told the Public Accounts Committee that "we are not allowing people to discharge sewage into chalk streams".

Did he intentionally mislead or does he not know that it happens? 

https://t.co/HW3zHY8zIP
